required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Placebo- Controlled Study in Adolescents and Adults With Eosinophilic Esophagitis (EoE) Measuring Histologic Response and Determine if Reduction in Dysphagia is Achieved
clinical_study.official_title: Oral Budesonide Suspension (OBS) in Adolescent and Adult Subjects (11 to 55 Years of Age, Inclusive) With Eosinophilic Esophagitis: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: A study in adolescents and adults with eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE) to measure the histologic response and determine if any reduction in dysphagia is achieved.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Histologic response, defined as a peak eosinophil count of ≤6/HPF across all available esophageal levels at the final evaluation after 16 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

primary_outcome.measure: Dysphagia symptom response, defined as ≥30% reduction in the Dysphagia Symptom Questionnaire (DSQ) combined score (questions 2+3)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction in dysphagia symptoms, as measured by the DSQ combined score (binary response criteria and change)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of endoscopically identified esophageal features using the EoE Endoscopic Reference Score (EREFS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak eosinophil count (binary response criteria and change)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact on pain as measured by pain with swallowing on DSQ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact on symptoms as measured by combined DSQ rating of dysphagia and pain with swallowing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events by MedDRA preferred term as a measure of safety and tolerability
Pharmakokinetic data in adult subjects will be determined from the plasma concentration-time data for budesonide by non-compartmental analysis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period, (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC0-tau) for the plasma concentration-time data for budesonide by non-compartmental analysis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period, (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum concentration (Cmax) occurring at tmax for plasma concentration for budesonide by non-compartmental analysis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period, (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of maximum (tmax) for the observed concentration for budesonide by non-compartmental analysis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to the end of the treatment period, (visit at 16 weeks of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of histopathologic epithelial features combined total score by central reviewer grading and staging compared to placebo as measured by the EREFS

intervention.description: Oral Budesonide Suspension 10 mL of 0.2 mg/mL every morning and at bedtime
Identical presentation of the experimental drug administered orallys as specified

criteria.textblock: Planned duration of screening period: 3-6 weeks, planned duration of treatment period: 16 weeks, planned duration of safety follow-up period: 4 weeks
